content.question: A curve is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, a, t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, b t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are constants. What is the length of the curve from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of a, plus b, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2, times the square root of a, plus b, end root, and denominator 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of a, squared, plus b squared, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator the square root of a, squared, plus b squared, end root, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of a, squared, plus b squared, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.3: (BC ONLY) Finding Arc Lengths of Curves Given by Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
